intro: Pericalymma, commonly known as the "cup-leaved daisy," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive cup-shaped leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants are native to Australia and are often found in dry, sandy soils. Pericalymma species typically have small, yellow to white flowers that bloom in spring or early summer. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
